alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 10:04AM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah affecting Decatur and Hardin Counties. For the Tennessee River...including PICKWICK DAM HEADWATER, Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 373.0 feet, Coffee Landing Road is under 3 ft of water at some places and evacuation is very difficult. Riverside Lane in Crump is flooded at Gattis Creek. Leaning Trees Road going to the Riverview settlement is flooded at Hardin Slough. Low spots along Connie Beth Lane and Horse Creek are flooded. Wayne Jerrolds River Park boat parking area is beginning to flood. Low spots on Emerald Lane are flooding north of Clover Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 367.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 372.5 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 372.5 feet on 01/13/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
